steps.name: the application is running

elements.name: Dashboard loads immediately after User login

steps.name: User account exists and is active
User is logged out
User opens the login page
User enters valid credentials
User clicks Login button
login should succeed
Dashboard page should load automatically
Dashboard title heading should be visible
no unexpected errors should be shown
the application is running

elements.name: Navigation menu highlights Dashboard as active for User

steps.name: User is logged in
User is on Dashboard page
User observes the left sidebar menu
"Dashboard" menu item should be visually highlighted as active
other menu items should not be highlighted as active
the application is running

elements.name: Dashboard summary cards are visible for User

steps.name: User is logged in
User is on Dashboard page
User looks at the main content area
Categories card should be displayed
Plants card should be displayed
Sales card should be displayed
Inventory card should be displayed
each card should show label and short description
each card should show numeric values amounts
no undefined null text should appear in cards
the application is running

elements.name: View buttons navigate to correct modules for User

steps.name: User is logged in
Dashboard is loaded
User clicks available dashboard buttons
respective pages should open correctly
User should be able to navigate back to Dashboard
no 404 blank page should occur
back navigation should return to Dashboard correctly
the application is running

elements.name: User can see Dashboard and permitted menu items

steps.name: User account exists
User is logged in
User is on Dashboard
all permitted menu items should be visible for User
each menu item should open the correct page
User clicks Logout
logout should end the session
system should return to login page
after logout dashboard should not be accessible without login

name: Dashboard Functionality
description:
As a user of the Plant Sales application
  I want to access and interact with the Dashboard
  So that I can view summary information and navigate to different modules

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_12 - Verify sorting by Quantity column
elements.description:
"""
    Test Summary: Verify sorting by Quantity column.
    Test Description: Test quantity sorting with numeric values.
    Precondition: User is on Sales List page.
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Quantity column header is visible and clickable
verify initial quantities are displayed
expected descending order should be 5, 3, 2
user clicks Quantity column header once
quantities should be sorted in ascending order
expected ascending order should be 2, 3, 5
user clicks Quantity column header again
quantities should be sorted in descending order
expected descending order should be 5, 3, 2
user clicks Quantity column header once
quantities should be sorted in ascending order
expected ascending order should be 2, 3, 5
user clicks Quantity column header once
quantities should be sorted in descending order
expected descending order should be 5, 3, 2
user clicks Quantity column header again
quantities should be sorted in ascending order
expected ascending order should be 2, 3, 5

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_12_Positive - Verify ascending sort by Quantity
elements.description:
"""
    Verify that clicking Quantity header sorts in ascending order (low to high)
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Quantity column header is visible and clickable
user clicks Quantity column header once
quantities should be sorted in ascending order
expected ascending order should be 2, 3, 5

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_12_Negative - Verify descending sort by Quantity
elements.description:
"""
    Verify that clicking Quantity header again sorts in descending order (high to low)
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Quantity column header is visible and clickable
user clicks Quantity column header once
quantities should be sorted in ascending order
user clicks Quantity column header again
quantities should be sorted in descending order
expected descending order should be 5, 3, 2

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_12_Toggle - Verify Quantity sort toggle functionality
elements.description:
"""
    Verify that Quantity column sorting toggles between ascending and descending
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Quantity column header is visible and clickable
user clicks Quantity column header once
quantities should be sorted in ascending order
user clicks Quantity column header again
quantities should be sorted in descending order
user clicks Quantity column header once
quantities should be sorted in ascending order

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_11 - Verify sorting by Plant Name column
elements.description:
"""
    Test Summary: Verify sorting by Plant Name column.
    Test Description: Click Plant Name header to toggle between ascending and descending sort.
    Precondition: User logged in, Sales for plants exist, User is on Sales List page.
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Plant Name column header is visible and clickable
verify initial plant names are displayed
expected descending order should be "ZZZ Plant", "Money Plant", "Aloe Vera"
user clicks Plant Name column header once
sales should be sorted in ascending order by Plant Name
expected ascending order should be "Aloe Vera", "Money Plant", "ZZZ Plant"
user clicks Plant Name column header again
sales should be sorted in descending order by Plant Name
expected descending order should be "ZZZ Plant", "Money Plant", "Aloe Vera"

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_13 - Verify sorting by Total Price column
elements.description:
"""
    Test Summary: Verify sorting by Total Price column.
    Test Description: Test monetary value sorting.
    Precondition: User logged in, Sales with prices: $9.99, $24.50, $49.99, $120.00, User is on Sales List page.
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Total Price column header is visible and clickable
verify initial total prices are displayed
user clicks Total Price column header once
total prices should be sorted in ascending order
expected ascending order should be "$9.99", "$24.50", "$49.99", "$120.00"
user clicks Total Price column header again
total prices should be sorted in descending order
expected descending order should be "$120.00", "$49.99", "$24.50", "$9.99"

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_13_Positive - Verify ascending sort by Total Price
elements.description:
"""
    Verify that clicking Total Price header sorts in ascending order (low to high)
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Total Price column header is visible and clickable
user clicks Total Price column header once
total prices should be sorted in ascending order
expected ascending order should be "$9.99", "$24.50", "$49.99", "$120.00"

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_13_Negative - Verify descending sort by Total Price
elements.description:
"""
    Verify that clicking Total Price header again sorts in descending order (high to low)
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Total Price column header is visible and clickable
user clicks Total Price column header once
total prices should be sorted in ascending order
user clicks Total Price column header again
total prices should be sorted in descending order
expected descending order should be "$120.00", "$49.99", "$24.50", "$9.99"

elements.name: TC_UI_SAL_13_Toggle - Verify Total Price sort toggle functionality
elements.description:
"""
    Verify that Total Price column sorting toggles between ascending and descending
    """

steps.name: user is logged into the application
user navigates to Sales List page
user is on Sales List page
sales records are displayed for plants
Total Price column header is visible and clickable
user clicks Total Price column header once
total prices should be sorted in ascending order
user clicks Total Price column header again
total prices should be sorted in descending order
user clicks Total Price column header once
total prices should be sorted in ascending order

name: Sales List Total Price Sorting Functionality
